item.title: The COVID Archives & the Church ft. Pastor Nathan Zekveld [Open Mike with Michael Thiessen]
item.description:
OPEN MIKE w/Michael Thiessen ~ July 27, 2024
On this episode of Open Mike, Dr. Thiessen talks to Pastor Nathan Zekveld about his NEW book The Covid Archives.  They discuss various topics related to COVID and its impact on society, the importance of remembering history, the concept of Christian witness, and the silencing of dissenting voices during the COVID-19 pandemic. They also talk about the role of experts and academia in shaping public opinion. Overall, the conversation emphasizes the need for critical thinking and the recognition of individual freedoms. The conversation explores the themes of Christian liberty, the divisiveness caused by mandatory vaccinations and lockdowns, the presence of pragmatism in the church, the rise of wokeness in Canada, and the need for reconciliation within congregations across Canada.

item.title: E** Faces Nashville Sentencing with Joyful China Memories and a Moving Song! [China Compass]
item.description:
On this special episode of the China Compass Podcast, Evangelina faces her upcoming Nashville sentencing (July 30, 2024) with faith and joy.

Then we talk through many happy (and scary) China memories, including her near escape (when I was deported).

Finally, she shares how my little deportation book (Unbeaten.vip), was a blessing to her (esp. the Appendix: Remember My Chains), then plays and sings the beautiful and powerful song, Remember Me.

She wrote this song about interceding for the persecuted partly based on my message, and partly from her own experience in US Prisons. 

As always, the China Compass Podcast is brought to you by www.PrayforChina.us!

🔥 Aprende cómo sumergirte en la Palabra de Dios (Romanos 10:17)

🔥 Practicar la oración persistente (Lucas 18:1)

🔥 Poner tu fe en acción a través del servicio (Santiago 2:17)

✏️ Explora estrategias prácticas para fortalecer tu relación con Dios y transformar tu vida espiritual. ¡Crece en tu fe y vive una vida que glorifique a Dios!

item.title: What Political Alternatives Do Christian Have? [God, Law, and Liberty]
item.description: After the events of the last 10 days, some Christian policy organizations are circling back to how Christians should respond to the new Republican Party Platform. Today, David uses Isaiah and John Owen to probe whether observations made by one prominent national organization go deeply enough in explaining how 45 years of work were, in its words, “wiped out in hours.”

item.title: Sheriff Richard Mack: Trump Assassination Attempt & the Constitutional Duties of a Sheriff [Dead Men Walking Podcast]
item.description:
This week Greg sat down with Sheriff Richard Mack. Sheriff Mack is a former Sheriff, Gun Owners of America Lobbyist, Two Time Congressional Candidate, and brought a successful lawsuit against Bill Clinton's Brady Act that was overturned at the Supreme Court. He is also the President of CSPOA. We discussed the Trump Assassination attempt, what went wrong, who was behind it, and the ineptitude of most bureaucrats in Washington. They also talked about the constitutional authority of a County sheriff, and how constitutional conservatives can change the liberal machine from the local level. This was a great episode! Enjoy!

item.title: John-William Noble: How Europe Lost Christianity, Where Presbyterians Got It Wrong [Let's Talk Eschatology]
item.description:
John-William Noble is a pastor of Grace Baptist Church Aberdeen, which he planted in 2019.

John-William is the founder of two christian schools, a Reformed Baptist publisher and the author of two books.

In this episode he discusses the major mistake of Scottish Presbyterians that lead to the ultimate secularization in Scotland, as well as the decline of Christianity overall in Europe.

item.title: TCND: Unite with Me and the Other Burning Bush (Not Moses) [The Comedian Next Door]
item.description:
New Baby Bridger is at the table! He has been a little cranky lately, so we'll see if he makes himself heard...

The baby is hearing and smelling new things, while old men are LOSING those senses.

John remembers the old man neighbor who used to "putter" around and do Old Man things when John was a kid. 

That's the neighbor whose bushes were set on fire by Bob Branyan... Let us tell you the story!

Later: John had a brief conversation with a Christian lady about "unity." But did she really mean "just agree with me"?

Email the Comedian's family at nextdoor@johnbranyan.com .

item.title: C. S. Lewis, Oxford Don: An Interview with Dr. Simon Horobin [The Pugcast]
item.description:
The Pugs continue their adventure in Oxford with an interview with Dr. Simon Horobin, the man behind the recently released book C. S. Lewis's Oxford. Dr. Horobin is an authority in medieval literature and teaches at Magdalen College. The Pugs joined Dr. Horobin in his room at Magdalen, not for from the rooms where Lewis taught and met with the Inklings. The conversation was rich and covers a lot of ground. Enjoy!

 

Order C. S. Lewis's Oxford: https://a.co/d/05QZ0wdj

 

Support the Pugcast on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/thetheologypugcast?fbclid=IwAR17UHhfzjphO52C_kkZfursA_C784t0ldFix0wyB4fd-YOJpmOQ3dyqGf8

 

The Theology Pugcast is a ministry of Trinity Reformed Church in Huntsville Alabama. To view more media from TRC, visit their website: https://trinityreformedkirk.com/trc-media/
item.author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC

item.title: China’s Take on Trump Shooting, Scissor Robbers in Guangdong (Canton) [China Compass]
item.description:
Welcome to the China Compass Podcast (from Lima, Peru)! Today, I start by looking at China's "take" on the assassination attempt on former president Trump, and how the Commies use the news for their own propaganda purposes...

A nation under strain: What the Trump assassination attempt reveals about America

https://www.chinadaily.com.cn/a/202407/16/WS669660aea31095c51c50e67b.html

Trump T-shirts that flooded Chinese retail sites after the shooting have disappeared

https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/trump-assassination-attempt-shooting-china-t-shirts-disappear-online-rcna162042

*China Compass is brought to you by Pray for China: www.PrayforChina.us --- Follow @chinaadventures for daily prayer updates!

Today's featured province is Guangdong (aka, Canton). After a quick overview of this heavily populated region, it's story time. I talk about the time I was almost robbed with a pair of scissors while taking a midnight nap, my first experience with Chinese beggars, and my first encounter with the Chinese police, that almost stopped my career in China even before it got started. 

*Unbeaten is my story of being arrested, interrogated and deported from China in 2018: www.Unbeaten.vip

Finally, we tackle some new China Compass Q&A, followed by William Borden's account of the Guangdong "boat people" in 1904.

*Borden of Yale is a classic missionary biography written by Hudson Taylor's DIL: www.BordenofYale.com
item.author: FLF, LLC

item.title: Examining the Pagan Predicates of the New Republican Party Platform [God, Law, and Liberty]
item.description: Changes in the Republican Party’s platform’s planks regarding abortion and marriage riled Christian political advocates who actively sought a minority report with different language. But did they read the Preamble? Today, David explains why he thinks its provisions represent the best of humanistic hubris and explain why abortion and marriage were left to walk the proverbial plank.

item.title: Ep. 116: A Christian Perspective on the Attempted Assassination of Donald Trump [The Outstanding Podcast]
item.description: Whether you love, hate, or tolerate him - the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump has left many Americans stunned and questioning how this will impact the upcoming election. Host Joseph Backholm is joined by FRC's Senior Fellow Owen Strachan for a discussion on the biblical response to the almost fatal shot. If God wanted to end Donald Trump's life, he would have - but why did he allow another to take the bullet? Joseph and Owen unpack their raw reactions to hearing the news, the difference between coincidence and God ordained, and God's sovereignty ordaining evil for good. As Christians, we are not called to give up on the public square. May we trust our God is faithful and working on our behalf.

item.description:
Life-threatening, deceitful, and traumatic, the abortion pill is ruining lives. Host Joseph Backholm is joined by pro-life speaker and author, Elizabeth Gillette, as she shares her story of being a victim of chemical abortion. Elizabeth shares how she was manipulated by people and organizations she thought she could trust, the lies Planned Parenthood showed and told her, and how the chemical abortion has and will continue to affect her, both emotionally and physically. Joseph and Elizabeth warn of the dangers of taking the pill, along with the terrifying reality of how easy it is to obtain, no matter age or gender. Listen now to better understand the dangers and impacts of chemical abortions!

*Listener discretion -- this podcast goes into detailed description of a chemical abortion and the physical process that happens when the pill is consumed*

item.title: TCND - Toldja The Baby Would Interfere with The Podcast! (Family Poops on You) [The Comedian Next Door]
item.description:
It’s just you and me. No other podcast pals, just us. So, if you’ve been with us before, you know there was a baby on the way. Well, that baby has now made his grand entrance, and as predicted, it’s shaken up the podcast schedule. I feared the podcast might be canceled, but The Peaches assured me, "No worries, Dad, I'll pop out the baby, and we’ll be back on track, no big deal." Fast forward a couple of weeks, and here I am, solo at the mic because my usual crew is at the hospital with the newborn boy.

My kids have been griping about our intro music, calling it not just mediocre, but downright bad. So, I decided to skip it this week. Maybe it’s time for a new format: no music, just straight into the chatter. Let me know what you think.

Now, about the baby. His name is Bridger Luke Michael McKinney. That’s right, Bridger. Not Alexander, which I was half-expecting because Amanda was adamantly saying it wouldn’t be Alexander. But no, it's Bridger. And like all new names, it feels a bit odd. Babies are weird little strangers when they first arrive, but eventually, they grow into their names. Soon enough, Bridger will be running around, and it’ll be the perfect fit.

On a personal note, I got new hearing aids. The old ones conked out, so now I'm trying to get used to the new ones. It's like discovering sound all over again. I can hear leaves rustling and kids playing from a distance. It’s a game-changer, though my comedy shows have taken a hit since I struggle to hear the audience.

Speaking of senses, my taste and smell aren't what they used to be. I can barely smell coffee brewing unless I stick my nose right over the pot. Same goes for food. Everything tastes kind of the same unless it’s something drastic like a pepper versus a banana. So, if I ever compliment your cooking, take it with a grain of salt because I probably can’t taste how terrible it might be.
item.author: John Branyan
item.itunes:author: John Branyan
item.itunes:summary: I Told You The Baby Would Interfere...

item.title: Post-Mortem for Christian Colleges? An Interview with Dr. Phil LaFountain [The Pugcast]
item.description:
Another Christian college has closed its doors. This time, one of Chris's alma maters, Eastern Nazarene College, aka, ENC. ENC was a small Christian college on the south shore of Massachusetts, not far from Boston. The usual things were cited by the Trustees of the college as reasons for its demise--declining enrollment, financial challenges, etc. What the announcement didn't mention was the growth of liberalism, or in contemporary parlance, "wokeism" among the faculty and administration, and how that undermined the support of the school among its constituency. Today the Pugs are joined by Dr. Phil LaFountain, an old friend and classmate of Chris's. Phil was a professor of theology at ENC for 20 years, and at the end, one of the few conservatives still there. Listen in as the guys discuss what happened at ENC, and what might be happening at a Christian college you might be connected to.

 

Support the Pugcast on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/thetheologypugcast?fbclid=IwAR17UHhfzjphO52C_kkZfursA_C784t0ldFix0wyB4fd-YOJpmOQ3dyqGf8

 

The Theology Pugcast is a ministry of Trinity Reformed Church in Huntsville Alabama. To view more media from TRC, visit their website: https://trinityreformedkirk.com/trc-media/

item.title: Winning the Culture War Through Christian Education ft. Kevin Swanson [Open Mike with Michael Thiessen]
item.description:
OPEN MIKE w/Michael Thiessen ~ July 13, 2024
In this conversation, Dr. Michael Thiessen interviews Kevin Swanson, the host of the Generations podcast, about the importance of homeschooling and family-based discipleship. They discuss the biblical foundation for homeschooling, the dangers of secular education, and the need for parents to take responsibility for their children's education. They also touch on the importance of the fear of God and the role of Christian classics in education. The conversation highlights the need for a return to a biblical worldview and a deeper understanding of the gospel. The conversation explores the fall of Western civilization and the potential for a revival. It discusses the impact of education on the fear and reverence of God, the breakdown of the family, and the division in the nation. The conversation also touches on the US presidential debate and the need for humility in America. It concludes with a discussion on the impending fall of civilization and the potential for a great awakening.

 

Chapters
00:00 Introduction and Sponsorship
00:59 Guest Introduction and Personal Testimony
07:41 The Biblical Model of Education and Family-Based Discipleship
10:45 The Importance of the Fear of God in Education
13:24 Emphasizing Christian Classics in Education
25:00 The Great Divide in the Evangelical Church
30:40 The Impact of Education on the Fear of God
32:06 The Breakdown of the Family and the Division in the Nation
34:01 The US Presidential Debate and the Fall of Western Civilization
38:07 The Need for Humility in America
41:22 The Impending Fall of Civilization and the Potential for a Great Awakening

item.title: More on the Nashville 10, American Summer Camp in Fujian, and a 4 Hour Email at a Chinese "Wangba" [China Compass]
item.description:
Welcome to the China Compass Podcast! I start by sharing some observations from last week's Nashville Sentencing, which took place just after I recorded the interviews with Denny and Uncle Bundo. 

The most important thing I mention is Denny's bold declaration to the judge, which you can read here: https://chinacall.substack.com/p/missionary-arrested-in-nashville

Also, please bookmark Denny's extensive online used bookstore, which is one of the primary ways he supports his family and ministry: https://www.remnantbooks.org/

In my interview with Uncle Bundo, we forgot to encourage everyone to pray for Heather Idoni, one of the Nashville 10 (and a grandmother!) who is already in federal prison due to a similar conviction last year: https://freeheatheridoni.com/

The CCP is brought to you by Pray for China (https://prayforchina.us/) and today's province is Fujian on China's SE coast (paired up with South Carolina). 

After a short overview of Fujian, I discuss China's subtle propaganda at a Summer Camp FOR AMERICANS in China, hosted outside of Fujian's capital, Fuzhou: https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2024/07/09/world/politics/xi-young-americans-scripted/

I also discuss China's CURRENT war with Taiwan, just miles away (in certain places) from Fujian: https://asiatimes.com/2024/06/chinas-war-with-taiwan-is-already-underway/

During story time, I tell about meeting a fighting couple (domestic abuse) and an elderly Christian man during the long walk through the old city streets of Fuzhou in 2003.

Finally, I finish by describing my attempt at pronouncing (and finding) "net bar" (wangba) in Fujian 20 years ago, and the time I spent four hours(!) writing an email to my now wife.
item.author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC

item.title: Remember That Time John Cooper Defended Kenosha?? | FlashBack Friday [CrossPolitic Show]
item.description:
Originally aired on November 4th 2020.

The guys were joined by John Cooper of the Christian Rock band Skillet and podcast Cooper Stuff to talk about why Christians have gone so woke. 

Don’t forget to Sign up for The FLF Conference 2024 (Prodigal America)

https://flfnetwork.com/prodigal-america/
